event-group.description: common functions used by each control group.
event-group.title: # control utilities

variable.comment: enemy damage variable to change how much damage melee does
variable.name: MAGICDAMAGE1

sub-events.comment: on shift pressed, if player isnt dashing already,
= player moves into dashing animation
= player gets x velocity max changed to determined value
on h pressed, if player isnt attacking already
= player slashes arms and staff
= hitbox gets created in front
# colisions for hitbox are off so it doesnt move the player backwards. #

variable.comment: enemy damage variable to change how much damage melee does
variable.name: MELEEDAMAGE

sub-events.comment: check if hitbox spawned and is overlapping <enemy>,
= damage enemy
= destroy hitbox
# animation

event-group.description: wasd controls for game. Can be activated / deactivated if needed.
event-group.title: keyboard movement

sub-events.comment: # move player right if he isnt walljumping.
# move player left if he isnt walljumping.
# make player jump if hes on the floor. As well as well as mario style jump by making gravity stronger if space is released.
# player can walljump with spacebar
# set players walljump trigger box to the player while hes on screen
# if player is overlapping ledge grab trigger object then enable and disable movement then launch at speed thats set with the ledge grab trigger object.
# else, walljump up walls that permit.
# if player has wall to left or right
# if d is down set animation to wall slide and set max fall speed to 25 if player isnt walljumping.
# play wall jump sound as well as add dust animation, set max speed to launch player out left, set to other direction, and simulate jump on wall.
# play wall jump sound as well as add dust animation, set max speed to launch player out left, set to other direction, and simulate jump on wall.

# press h to execute player melee
# animation check - need to check player input to set players animation back to what the player is doing so it looks smooth and not choppy
